data.question: What is the chemical formula of the Co-MOF discussed in the paper?
What are the two main functionalities of the Co-MOF mentioned?
data.answer: Proton conduction and fluorescence sensing of Fe3+ ions

data.question: What is the conductivity value of the Co-MOF along the [001] direction at 55 °C and 95% RH?
Can the Co-MOF selectively detect Fe3+ ions in the presence of other interfering ions?
What is the limit of detection (LOD) for Fe3+ ions by the Co-MOF?
Is the proton conduction of the Co-MOF anisotropic?
What mechanism does proton transfer in the Co-MOF follow?
Does the Co-MOF maintain its structure after being soaked in Fe3+ solution for 24 hours?

Is the proton conductivity of the Co-MOF dependent on humidity?
What is the role of the oba ligand in the structure of the Co-MOF?
data.answer: Acts as a pillar in the pillar-layer structure

data.question: What is the effect of temperature on the proton conductivity of the Co-MOF?
Can the Co-MOF be regenerated for repeated use in Fe3+ sensing?
What is the effect of adding Fe3+ ions on the fluorescence intensity of the Co-MOF?
Does the Co-MOF exhibit good water stability?

data.answer: Indicates the type of proton migration mechanism

data.question: Is the proton conduction of the Co-MOF stable over time?
What is the role of temperature and humidity in the proton conduction of the Co-MOF?
data.answer: Both temperature and humidity positively affect the proton conduction

data.question: Does the Co-MOF's structure allow for selective detection of Fe3+ ions?
What is the role of the atz ligand in the Co-MOF's structure?
data.answer: Links Co-clusters to form a layer in the structure
